body: I think that OpenCV could be OK.

My thoughts on this, all of which should be fixed for the next release:

1. Headers:

Any file that existed before the dmlc->apache move should have two headers. The old one and the standard ASF one. Any file that was created after the code move should have only the standard ASF header. Note that this is high level, there may be a file that has other types of src headers, like maybe a piece of BSD code was copied in etc. 

2. License files. All these should be fixed. 

--

On your questions:

1: I don't think we should be changing those two files. The files are currently in dmlc and not in apache. They are a style-bug in dmlc, and we do have the question of whether we should be pulling this code into mxnet as source the way we do.

2: I believe this means putting back "* Copyright (c) 2015 by Contributors" (or sometimes a different year), wherever that was deleted in https://github.com/apache/incubator-mxnet/pull/7379

3: It does look confusing. It looks like it came in on this pull request pre-Apache days: https://github.com/apache/incubator-mxnet/pull/891 . As it was a contribution to an Apache 2.0 licensed project, the contribution would be under Apache 2.0. It looks like it is a specific version of the DMLC "Copyright Contributors" that is listing the 3 contributors who worked on the pull request. I would treat it the same as you do other DMLC files that say Copyright, but in this case list the three people instead of 'Contributors'.
where is it?

The 0.11.0 version pip wheel didn't include request as dependency, we have fixed it in the recent nightly builds.
You have two options

- Install request manually: `sudo -H pip install requests`
- Install the latest build by `sudo -H pip install -U mxnet --pre`
sym.contrib or contrib.sym are now equivalent methods in the latest mxnet.

The current str key support in dist-kvstore is very limited:
- it assumes all workers have the same key set
- it assumes the keys are initialized in the same order
To truly support str-key with dist-kvstore, we also need to record a int key->str key mapping on the server side, which is not implemented for now. One way to implement this is just use rank0 server as a coordinator, which serializes all the key requests when keys are initialized. The workers have to send an extra message to the coordinator to get the int key during str key initialization. You're welcome to try to fix it and post a PR for this.

Thank you, Shiwen.

Could you describe the API change first? I doubt this can be implemented cleanly, especially in the backend.

Without adding asymmetrical padding, what's the new feature that couldn't be done before?
Floating point math is not exact. If the mismatch happens at random places with a small error, it's to be expected

@JulianSlzr do you prefer to limit the shape inference where asymmetric padding isn't needed in this change? In that case making the padding size inference in the frontend is likely easier. Asymmetric padding on the other hand will have to happen on each conv op.
Did you mean that you could train with custom op but failed to load it?

@eric-haibin-lin 
That's right. I can train but can't load trained model to predict.

For imperative execution the (dense) operator always use `kWriteTo` for now. kWriteInplace is usually added for symbolic execution, where MXNet performs extensive memory planning. 

Also there's a good note regarding mem optimization in MXNet for background. https://mxnet.incubator.apache.org/architecture/note_memory.html

I'm closing this issue for now. For further questions/discussion, we're moving to https://discuss.mxnet.io

@piiswrong This is largely syntactic sugar (imagine tuning `kernel_size`, `dilation`, and `stride`; the user can simply set `padding=-1` once to keep layer sizes constant). If we support modes like `'full'` (or `'valid'`, which is equivalent to `padding=0`) in the future, the API could look like:

`padding: int, str, or list of int/strs, where str is one of 'same', 'full', etc.`

and one might write:

`nn.Conv3D(channels=300, kernel_size=(3, 5, 7), padding=('same', 0, 'full'))`

However, there is **novelty** when `stride > 1`; the input size needs to be known, as padding no longer simplifies to `dilated_kernel_size // 2`. I just saw that Theano compromised here; it defines `'half'` as this quantity outright, and never implemented `'same'`: http://deeplearning.net/software/theano/library/tensor/nnet/conv.html

@szha I think this novelty makes it hard to do on the front-end, but I'd love to be corrected. A practical approach could be to ship, in order:
1. A frontend version (`stride=1`, symmetrical), with API
2. A backend version (arb. stride, symmetrical)
3. An asymmetrical backend version

The first is a quick win people would use (e.g., porting models from other frameworks). We can implement the rest as demand permits. I'm seeing more how hard things like (3) are, as e.g., cuDNN's API doesn't support it.
Is there anything remaining to address? @eric-haibin-lin @piiswrong
The problem is how you pass same and full to backend. Using negative numbers maybe problematic: do we want to support negative padding?

```diff
+julia -e 'Pkg.build("MXNet")'
+julia -e 'Pkg.test("MXNet")'
```

HybridBlock already allows changing the shape of inputs, as long as graph topology is the same.

If graph topology itself changes, use Block instead.

If you still want to use hybridblock, create many hybridblocks that share parameters. This is easily done with param=source.collect_params() in constructor

I think its easier to let user handle this logic.
```
block_dict = {key: MyBlock(key, params=default_block.collect_params()) for key in keys}
block_dict[key](x)
```
This is pretty simple and likely faster than reading the documentation on how key_setter work.

Frontend could detect which positions are strings. We could use negative numbers for now, and if we want to support negative padding later on, we'd transparently introduce another list argument to the backend functions.

CNTK+Keras does this; look how Keras turns e.g., padding='same' for use by the more flexible CNTK interface (e.g., asymmetric padding, 'auto_padding' arguments, etc.):
https://github.com/fchollet/keras/blob/master/keras/backend/cntk_backend.py#L1471

I agree that this should be useful. The sparse version will need to be changed along with the dense version. cc @eric-haibin-lin in case there would be any complication.

Regarding the parameter name, the vision community introduced it as ``epsilon``(https://arxiv.org/pdf/1512.00567.pdf), but it's really just a form of exponential/'alpha' smoothing, so I am not sure I have a better name at this point.

I see the same issue. I am following instructions here
https://mxnet.incubator.apache.org/get_started/install.html
did you use python2 or python3 ?
--gpus=0,1,2,3 means use 4 gpus

The default value of environment parameter MXNET_KVSTORE_BIGARRAY_BOUND is 10^6.
In key-value pairs, if the number of values larger than MXNET_KVSTORE_BIGARRAY_BOUND, this key-value pair will be split into num_servers parts and stored partly.

example/gluon/image_classification.py:

gpus = opt.gpus

if opt.benchmark:
    #batch_size = 6
    dataset = 'dummy'
    classes = 1000

batch_size = int(total_size/max(1, gpus))

print "batch_size:%d, batch_per_device:%d"  % (total_size,batch_size)

context = [mx.gpu(i) for i in range(gpus)] if gpus > 0 else [mx.cpu()]

This refers to both the points - 
a.  Any file that existed before the dmlc->apache move should have two headers. The old one and the standard ASF one. Any file that was created after the code move should have only the standard ASF header. Note that this is high level, there may be a file that has other types of src headers, like maybe a piece of BSD code was copied in etc.
b.  I believe this means putting back "* Copyright (c) 2015 by Contributors" (or sometimes a different year), wherever that was deleted in #7379


2. License files. All these should be fixed. --**- done**
a) done
b) done
c) submodules - not done
d) done
e) submodules - not done
f) done / submodules- not done
g) done /submodules -not done
h) done - Henri in point 3 verified this file should have the ASF header
